targets.rawSql:
WITH t1 AS (WITH t AS (
    SELECT *, lag(value) OVER w value_l, lag(time_sec) OVER w time_sec_l
    FROM
        (SELECT
-- take the last datapoint in the interval
time_sec as time_sec,
memsql_sysinfo_cpu_used_ms/memsql_sysinfo_cpu_num_cpus value,
host
         FROM
             (SELECT
             max(time_sec) time_sec,
             -- this is the last counter in the time group
             max(intval) as value,
             name as metric,
             trim_host(host) host,
             $__unixEpochGroup(time_sec, $interval) as tg
             FROM metrics
             WHERE
             (cluster = '$cluster')
             and (host in ($host) or $host = '%')
             and (extractor = 'memsql')
             and (subsystem = 'sysinfo')
             and (name = 'memsql_sysinfo_cpu_used_ms' or name = 'memsql_sysinfo_cpu_num_cpus')
             and $__unixEpochFilter(time_sec)
             group by 3, 4, 5
             ) as pvt_data
             PIVOT
             (
                AVG(value)
                FOR metric
                IN ('memsql_sysinfo_cpu_used_ms', 'memsql_sysinfo_cpu_num_cpus')
             ) as pvt_table
        ) X
        WINDOW w AS (partition by host order by time_sec desc)
)
select a.time_sec, (value - value_l)/(1000*(time_sec - time_sec_l)) * 100 value, a.host from t a
WHERE time_sec_l is not null and value_l is not null
order by 1, 2 desc, 3)
SELECT time_sec, min(value) as `min single-core load`, avg(value) 'avg core load', max(value) as `max single-core load` from t1
group by time_sec
order by time_sec

select time_sec, 'Memory Usage' as metric, max(used) from (
select time_sec,
host,
memsql_sysinfo_mem_used_b / memsql_sysinfo_mem_total_b as used
FROM
(SELECT
max(time_sec) time_sec,
avg(value) value,
metric,
host
FROM
(SELECT
  time_sec,
  $__unixEpochGroup(time_sec,$interval) tg,
  intval as value,
  name as metric,
  CONCAT('{', trim_host(host), '}') as host
FROM metrics
WHERE cluster='$cluster'
and (host in ($host) or $host = '%')
and extractor = 'memsql'
and subsystem = 'sysinfo'
and name in ('memsql_sysinfo_mem_used_b','memsql_sysinfo_mem_total_b')
and $__unixEpochFilter(time_sec)
) X
GROUP BY tg, metric, host
) as pvt_data
PIVOT (
        AVG(value) 
        FOR metric 
        IN ('memsql_sysinfo_mem_used_b','memsql_sysinfo_mem_total_b')
) as pvt_table) a
group by time_sec
order by time_sec

select time_sec, 'Disk Usage' as metric, max(used) from (
select time_sec,
host,
memsql_sysinfo_disk_used_b / memsql_sysinfo_disk_total_b as used
FROM
(SELECT
max(time_sec) time_sec,
avg(value) value,
metric,
host
FROM
(SELECT
  time_sec,
  $__unixEpochGroup(time_sec,$interval) tg,
  intval as value,
  name as metric,
  CONCAT('{', trim_host(host), '}') as host
FROM metrics
WHERE cluster='$cluster'
and (host in ($host) or $host = '%')
and extractor = 'memsql'
and subsystem = 'sysinfo'
and name in ('memsql_sysinfo_disk_used_b','memsql_sysinfo_disk_total_b')
and $__unixEpochFilter(time_sec)
) X
GROUP BY tg, metric, host
) as pvt_data
PIVOT (
        AVG(value) 
        FOR metric 
        IN ('memsql_sysinfo_disk_used_b','memsql_sysinfo_disk_total_b')
) as pvt_table) a
group by time_sec
order by time_sec

panels.description: Number of open connections (threads_connected) to the database relative to the maximum limit (max_connections). If the utilization is near 100%, it means DB is approaching the maximum allowed connections; this can potentially lead to performance issues, as queries may need to wait in a queue until a thread becomes available to process them.

targets.rawSql:
select max(used_c / total_C) * 100 as `Threads - Connected`, 
       tg as time 
from (SELECT time_sec as time, 
             $__unixEpochGroup(time_sec, $interval) as tg, 
             sum(case when name = 'memsql_variables_max_connections' then value else 0 end) as total_c,
             sum(case when name = 'memsql_status_threads_connected' then value else 0 end) as used_c,
             host, port
     FROM metrics
     WHERE $__unixEpochFilter(time_sec) AND
           (cluster = '$cluster') AND
           NAME in ('memsql_variables_max_connections','memsql_status_threads_connected') 
     group by time, tg, host, port)
group by tg
order by tg;

panels.title: Threads - Connected

panels.description: Number of threads actively running queries (threads_running) relative to the maximum limit (max_connection_threads). If the utilization is near 100%, it suggests that the system might be reaching its capacity in terms of how many queries can be executed in parallel. This situation can lead to resource pressure, unresponsiveness, latency spikes, and even failures

targets.rawSql:
select tg as time,
       max(used_c / total_C) * 100 as 'Threads - Running:' 
from (SELECT time_sec as time, 
             $__unixEpochGroup(time_sec, $interval) as tg, 
             sum(case when name = 'memsql_variables_max_connection_threads' then value else 0 end) as total_c,
             sum(case when name = 'memsql_status_threads_running' then value else 0 end) as used_c,
             host, port
     FROM metrics
     WHERE $__unixEpochFilter(time_sec) AND
           (cluster = '$cluster') AND
           NAME in ('memsql_variables_max_connection_threads','memsql_status_threads_running') 
     group by time, tg, host, port)
group by tg
order by tg;

panels.title: Threads - Running

targets.rawSql:
WITH t AS (
  SELECT 
    *, 
    lag(value) OVER w value_l, 
    lag(time_sec) OVER w time_sec_l 
  FROM 
    (
      SELECT 
        max(time_sec) as time_sec, 
        avg(value) as value, 
        metric 
      FROM 
        (
          SELECT 
            time_sec, 
            $__unixEpochGroup(time_sec, $interval) as tg, 
            intval as value, 
            concat(name, host) as metric 
          FROM 
            `metrics` 
          WHERE 
            $__unixEpochFilter(time_sec) 
            and (cluster = '$cluster') 
            and (host in ($host) or $host = '%')
            and extractor = 'memsql' 
            and subsystem = 'status' 
            and name like 'memsql_status_%_write_queries'
            and role <> 'LEAF') subq 
      GROUP BY 
        metric, 
        tg
    ) X WINDOW w AS (
      partition by metric 
      order by 
        time_sec
    )
) 
SELECT 
  time_sec, 
  sum((value - value_l)/(time_sec - time_sec_l)) as 'Write queries per second'
FROM 
  t a 
where 
  time_sec_l is not null 
  and value_l is not null 
 and value >= value_l 
group by
  time_sec
order by 
  time_sec

WITH t AS (
  SELECT 
    *, 
    lag(value) OVER w value_l, 
    lag(time_sec) OVER w time_sec_l 
  FROM 
    (
      SELECT 
        max(time_sec) as time_sec, 
        max(value) as value, 
        metric 
      FROM 
        (
          SELECT 
            time_sec, 
            $__unixEpochGroup(time_sec, $interval) as tg, 
            intval as value, 
            concat(name, host) as metric 
          FROM 
            `metrics` 
          WHERE 
            $__unixEpochFilter(time_sec) 
            and (cluster = '$cluster') 
            and (host in ($host) or $host = '%')
            and extractor = 'memsql' 
            and subsystem = 'status' 
            and name = 'memsql_status_rows_affected_by_writes'
            and role <> 'LEAF') subq 
      GROUP BY 
        metric, 
        tg
    ) X WINDOW w AS (
      partition by metric 
      order by 
        time_sec
    )
) 
SELECT 
  time_sec, 
  sum((value - value_l)/(time_sec - time_sec_l)) as 'Rows written per second'
FROM 
  t a 
where 
  time_sec_l is not null 
  and value_l is not null 
 and value >= value_l 
group by time_sec
order by 
  1

WITH t AS (
  SELECT 
    *, 
    lag(value) OVER w value_l, 
    lag(time_sec) OVER w time_sec_l 
  FROM 
    (
      SELECT 
        max(time_sec) as time_sec, 
        avg(value) as value, 
        metric 
      FROM 
        (
          SELECT 
            time_sec, 
            $__unixEpochGroup(time_sec, $interval) as tg, 
            intval as value, 
            concat(name, host) as metric 
          FROM 
            `metrics` 
          WHERE 
            $__unixEpochFilter(time_sec) 
            and (cluster = '$cluster') 
            and (host in ($host) or $host = '%')
            and extractor = 'memsql' 
            and subsystem = 'status' 
            and name like 'memsql_status_failed_write_queries'
            and role <> 'LEAF') subq 
      GROUP BY 
        metric, 
        tg
    ) X WINDOW w AS (
      partition by metric 
      order by 
        time_sec
    )
) 
SELECT 
  time_sec, 
  sum((value - value_l)/(time_sec - time_sec_l)) as 'Failed write queries per second'
FROM 
  t a 
where 
  time_sec_l is not null 
  and value_l is not null 
 and value >= value_l  
group by
  time_sec
order by 
  time_sec

panels.description: Changes in the pattern of execution time per write query from the historical norm may indicate an issue with your application or changes in your workload.

targets.rawSql:
WITH t AS (
            SELECT 
                *, 
                lag(value) OVER w value_l, 
                lag(time) OVER w time_l
            from (
                  select max(tg) as time,
                         max(value) as value,
                         metric, name
                  from (
                        SELECT  time_sec,
                                $__unixEpochGroup(time_sec, $interval) as tg, 
                                concat(name, host) as metric,
                                name,
                                value
                        FROM metrics
                        WHERE $__unixEpochFilter(time_sec) AND
                              cluster = '$cluster' AND
                              (host in ($host) or $host = '%') AND
                              role <> 'LEAF' AND
                              name in ('memsql_status_failed_write_queries','memsql_status_successful_write_queries','memsql_status_execution_time_of_write')
                        )
                  group by metric, tg) X 
            WINDOW w AS (partition by metric order by time))
select time, 
       sum(case when name = 'memsql_status_execution_time_of_write' then (value - value_l) end) /
       sum(case when name in ('memsql_status_failed_write_queries','memsql_status_successful_write_queries') then (value - value_l) end) as 'Execution Time per Write Query'
from t
where time_l is not null 
  and value_l is not null 
  and value >= value_l
group by time
order by time

panels.title: Execution Time per Write Query

targets.rawSql:
WITH t AS (
  SELECT 
    *, 
    lag(value) OVER w value_l, 
    lag(time_sec) OVER w time_sec_l 
  FROM 
    (
      SELECT 
        max(time_sec) as time_sec, 
        avg(value) as value, 
        metric 
      FROM 
        (
          SELECT 
            time_sec, 
            $__unixEpochGroup(time_sec, $interval) as tg, 
            intval as value, 
            concat(name, host) as metric 
          FROM 
            `metrics` 
          WHERE 
            $__unixEpochFilter(time_sec) 
            and (cluster = '$cluster') 
            and (host in ($host) or $host = '%')
            and extractor = 'memsql' 
            and subsystem = 'status' 
            and name like 'memsql_status_%_read_queries'
            and role <> 'LEAF') subq 
      GROUP BY 
        metric, 
        tg
    ) X WINDOW w AS (
      partition by metric 
      order by 
        time_sec
    )
) 
SELECT 
  time_sec, 
  sum((value - value_l)/(time_sec - time_sec_l)) as 'Read queries per second'
FROM 
  t a 
where 
  time_sec_l is not null 
  and value_l is not null 
 and value >= value_l 
group by
  time_sec
order by 
  time_sec

FROM

where

 and value >= value_l 
group by time_sec

WITH t AS (
  SELECT 
    *, 
    lag(value) OVER w value_l, 
    lag(time_sec) OVER w time_sec_l 
  FROM 
    (
      SELECT 
        max(time_sec) as time_sec,

panels.description: Changes in the pattern of execution time per read query from the historical norm may indicate an issue with your application or changes in your workload.

targets.rawSql:
WITH t AS (
            SELECT 
                *, 
                lag(value) OVER w value_l, 
                lag(time) OVER w time_l
            from (
                  select max(tg) as time,
                         max(value) as value,
                         metric, name
                  from (
                        SELECT  time_sec,
                                $__unixEpochGroup(time_sec, $interval) as tg, 
                                concat(name, host) as metric,
                                name,
                                value
                        FROM metrics
                        WHERE $__unixEpochFilter(time_sec) AND
                              cluster = '$cluster' AND
                              (host in ($host) or $host = '%') AND
                              role <> 'LEAF' AND
                              name in ('memsql_status_failed_read_queries','memsql_status_successful_read_queries','memsql_status_execution_time_of_reads')
                        )
                  group by metric, tg) X 
            WINDOW w AS (partition by metric order by time))
select time, 
       sum(case when name = 'memsql_status_execution_time_of_reads' then (value - value_l) end) /
       sum(case when name in ('memsql_status_failed_read_queries','memsql_status_successful_read_queries') then (value - value_l) end) as 'Execution Time per Read Query'
from t
where time_l is not null 
  and value_l is not null 
  and value >= value_l
group by time
order by time

panels.title: Execution Time per Read Query

targets.rawSql:
WITH t AS (
SELECT *, lag(value) OVER w value_l, lag(time_sec) OVER w time_sec_l
FROM 
(SELECT
  max(time_sec) time_sec,
  $__unixEpochGroup(time_sec,$interval) tg,
  avg(intval) as value,
  trim_metric(name, 'memsql_status_bytes_') as metric,
  trim_host(host) host,
  port
FROM metrics
WHERE (cluster = '$cluster')
and (extractor = 'memsql')
and (subsystem = 'status')
and name in ('memsql_status_bytes_sent')
and $__unixEpochFilter(time_sec)
GROUP BY metric, host, port, tg
) X
WINDOW w AS (partition by metric, host, port order by time_sec desc)
)
select time_sec, sum((value - value_l)/(time_sec - time_sec_l)) as 'Network Sent Bytes' 
from t a
where time_sec_l is not null and value_l is not null
group by time_sec
order by time_sec

WITH t AS (
SELECT *, lag(value) OVER w value_l, lag(time_sec) OVER w time_sec_l
FROM 
(SELECT
  max(time_sec) time_sec,
  $__unixEpochGroup(time_sec,$interval) tg,
  avg(intval) as value,
  trim_metric(name, 'memsql_status_bytes_') as metric,
  trim_host(host) host,
  port
FROM metrics
WHERE (cluster = '$cluster')
and (extractor = 'memsql')
and (subsystem = 'status')
and name in ('memsql_status_bytes_received')
and $__unixEpochFilter(time_sec)
GROUP BY metric, host, port, tg
) X
WINDOW w AS (partition by metric, host, port order by time_sec desc)
)
select time_sec, sum((value - value_l)/(time_sec - time_sec_l)) as 'Network Received Bytes' 
from t a
where time_sec_l is not null and value_l is not null
group by time_sec
order by time_sec

list.definition: select distinct(database_name) from act_samples where $__timeFilter(ts) and (cluster = '$cluster')
list.name: database_name
list.query: select distinct(database_name) from act_samples where $__timeFilter(ts) and (cluster = '$cluster')

list.name: host
list.query: select distinct(host) from metrics where host is not NULL and $__unixEpochFilter(time_sec) and (cluster='$cluster')
